claim-text.content: 1. A method for controlling a power assisted steering system of a vehicle, the method comprising:

receiving at least two signals from at least two sensors of the power assisted steering system, each of the signals corresponding to at least one of a vehicle speed, a longitudinal acceleration, a lateral acceleration, and a vertical acceleration, wherein the two signals are different;

allowing unimpeded steering within a permissible steering rack travel that is based on at least one of the vehicle speed, the longitudinal acceleration, the lateral acceleration, and the vertical acceleration;

when a steering rack position has reached a boundary of the permissible steering rack travel, providing counter assist torque to prohibit movement of a steering rack of the vehicle beyond the permissible steering rack travel;

when the steering rack position has exceeded the permissible steering rack travel, providing counter assist torque to return the steering rack of the vehicle to a position within the permissible steering rack travel; and
further comprising, if the vehicle speed is less than a predetermined speed, setting the permissible steering rack travel to an optimum steering rack travel;
wherein the optimum steering rack travel is based on at least the vehicle speed, a suspension travel, the longitudinal acceleration, the lateral acceleration, and the vertical acceleration.

claim.body: 1 further comprising, if the vehicle speed is equal to or greater than a predetermined speed, setting the permissible steering rack travel to a value equal to the optimum steering rack travel minus a travel reduction.

content: further comprising, if the vehicle speed is equal to or greater than a predetermined speed, setting the permissible steering rack travel to a value equal to the optimum steering rack travel minus a travel reduction.

claim.body: the travel reduction is equal to about 5 millimeters.

content: , wherein the travel reduction is equal to about 5 millimeters.

claim.body: the permissible steering rack travel is calculated by subtracting, from an optimum steering rack travel, an amount obtained by dividing a maximum of a right and a left suspension travel amount by the optimum steering rack travel amount multiplied by a travel reduction based on vehicle speed.

content: , wherein the permissible steering rack travel is calculated by subtracting, from an optimum steering rack travel, an amount obtained by dividing a maximum of a right and a left suspension travel amount by the optimum steering rack travel amount multiplied by a travel reduction based on vehicle speed.

claim.body: the travel reduction is equal to about 5 millimeters.

content: , wherein the travel reduction is equal to about 5 millimeters.

claim.body: the counter assist torque is provided via a motor of the vehicle.

content: , wherein the counter assist torque is provided via a motor of the vehicle.

claim.body: steering rack travel based on the optimum steering rack travel.

content: , further comprising limiting steering rack travel based on the optimum steering rack travel.

claim.body: further comprising providing a feedback to a vehicle driver when a current steering rack travel exceeds the optimum steering rack travel.

content: , further comprising providing a feedback to a vehicle driver when a current steering rack travel exceeds the optimum steering rack travel.

claim.body: the feedback to the vehicle driver is the counter assist torque.

content: , wherein the feedback to the vehicle driver is the counter assist torque.
